title: Send message error
content:
Suddenly getting error message window titled "Send Message Error" Reads" Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.peak.org failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again."

Checked with ISP and they have not blocked or many any changes and verified the SMTP settings are correct. Port 465 Connection Security SSL/TLS Authentication Method Normal Password.

I also at times received a Tbird window in the lower right of the screen that I couldn't using the snipping tool on to same. Says something about reducing the cache which I did to no avail, going from what I gather is a default 15 to 10.

Was sending messages without issue this morning but now can't get past the above message. Can send messages using the ISP's Zimbra webmail. They have no knowledge of Thunderbird and do not support it. I've read what I could find but didn't see anything replicating my issue.
creator: w7wll

title: Tool tips no longer display when message list display options is set to table view
content:
I have Thunderbird version 115.5.2 (32-bit) running on Windows 10. I recently noticed that none of the tool tips that I am accustomed to seeing in the message list display are appearing. After some investigation I found that these tool tips reappear if I switch the message list display options to "cards view" (I normally have it set to "table view"). This happens both in and out of troubleshoot mode. This feature is extremely useful to me because I don't have to open the message to see what the subject is or who sent it. For example, one message I have displays a subject of "Re: Allen Family P...", from "Carolyn Allen-Sch..." to "'Chris-', Karen All..." on "2/30/3035, 10:32...". Here I've chosen the worst offender in my list, to show just how much information is missing from the message list pane. Something that might be a little more important would be the message whose subject shows up as "Receipt for Your Pa..." from "service@paypal.co..." For obvious reasons, that might be a message that I just wanna delete without reading but I can't tell without the tool tips.

Obviously, I can just switch the display options to card view but then there's no quick and easy way to mark a message "unread" or more importantly, "junk."

Is there an option in config that will allow me to see these tool tips again (a quick search did not reveal any)? If not, is this a bug that needs to be fixed or a feature that will be reintroduced at some point?

Thanks.
creator: AuntieDiva

title: Calendar invite emails not sent
content:
Thunderbird 113 (?), local calendar, Win 10, email invites stopped being sent to the listed Attendees. Correct email was entered on Calendar/Properties/Email and Notify attendees was ticked in New Event dialogue. Attendees were correctly entered under New Event/Invite Attendees but after clicking Save and Close, there was no Invitation email record in "Sent" emails and no Attendees receives email invitations. The event was correctly saved in the originator's calendar.

TB 115.7.0 installed from scratch on a new Win 11 PC and the emails/calendar data transferred from the old PC. Everything works *except* that no invitation emails are still sent to the listed Attendees of a new event (same symptoms as on the Win 10 PC). So transferring emails and calendar entries transferred the problem to the new PC.

What next?
creator: jan.hruska

title: emails
content:
Since Mozilla has no points of contact I'll just throw this out here.

In early November I made a payment to Mozilla for Thunderbird. The program updated and all seemed well.

What I didn't realize until far too late was that the "delete after xx days button" was pushed and all my emails have been disappearing ever since then. Some were critical. And they are gone forever. Even my archive file is gone. If Thunderbird is going to do a full restore to defaults during any upgrade, that should be announced clearly. My life, and my grand daughter's life have been impacted by this glitch in the Mozilla system and I now regret having paid them a nickel.

CAUTION: watch out for the upgrades and check your file immediately afterwards. And if you ever need to contact Mozilla? Forget it. I liked the Netscape connection with Firefox but this situation really cuts deep. Particularly since it was so unnecessary.
creator: jimerie

title: Migrating from Windows to Linux
content: HI, I have switched from Windows to Linux but I do not know how to migrate Thunderbird. I have done it before from Windows to Windows. I saved my Thunderbird folder expecting to paste it into my new OS but I cannot figure out where to paste it. Clicking on "open directory" in "troubleshooting information" does nothing. I installed Thunderbird on the new OS. I pasted the folder in the home directory and renamed it .thunderbird, but the app still does not find my data. I am using elementary OS. I am new to Linux. Step by Step instructions help a lot. Thank you for your help!
creator: sean29
